--------------------
Text: The Nostoi (Greek: Νόστοι , "Nostoi", "Returns"), also known as Returns or Returns of the Greeks, is a lost epic of ancient Greek literature.
Triplets:<The Nostoi
2:
--------------------
Text: Nostoi:  The story of the "Nostoi" comes chronologically after that of the "Iliou persis" ("Sack of Ilium"), and is followed by that of the "Odyssey".
Triplets:<story of
3:
--------------------
Text: Nostoi:  The author of the "Nostoi" is uncertain: ancient writers attributed the poem variously to Agias, Homer, and Eumelos (see Cyclic poets).
Triplets:<Nostoi
4:
--------------------
Text: Nostoi:  The poem comprised five books of verse in dactylic hexameter.
Triplets:<Nostoi
5:
--------------------
Text: Nostoi:  The word "nostos" means "return home".
